# ***General's Pocket Manual***

| This ***Pocket Manual*** was written and kept updated by members of the ***Subreddit*** of Supremacy1914. This document is meant for both ***Veterans*** and ***Novices*** in the ***War Theatre***, with the finality of keeping all ***Generals*** updated on the latest changes of the game. <br/> It is my sincere hope that it serves you well on your journeys, and that it might be of assistance in a few of your victories. Remember to stay honourable and try to be polite and kind to whomever shows you the respect deserved. |

#### ***Notes & Observations:***

- When destroyed, ***Infrastructures*** with a ***Building Level*** superior to 1, will revert back one level (but with the full ***Health Points*** of level they are now in), while ***Infrastructures*** with a ***Building Level*** of 1 will be completely erased.
- ***Capital Buildings*** cannot be damaged by any means available to ***Generals***, meaning that only after a successful assault and conquest of an enemy ***Capital Province***, will this ***Infrastructure*** be erased from that same ***Province***.
- Disabling ***Infrastructures*** annuls any bonus they provide, alongside with the pausing of progress in the production of ***Military Units***, while also erasing the need to pay the ***Upkeep***.

<br/>

> ***The Recruiting Office is responsible for providing the constant enlistment and training of Infantry units so the battle can continue. War propaganda does wonders to appeal to the masses.***

##### ***Notes & Observations:***

- Enables the recruitment of ***Infantry*** units.
- Automatically recruits ***Infantry*** units, without any interference from the ***General***.
- Can be deactivated, at any time, which immediately halts the recruitment of ***Infantry*** units, but annuls the payment of the ***Upkeep*** at the same time.
- One might consider disabling ***Recruitment Offices*** when the ***Province*** they are on is about to be captured, in the hopes that the new owner does not realise their current status, preventing them from keeping the recruitment of ***Infantry*** units.
- In the ***Late Game***, if the ***General*** is having problems with the production of ***Grain*** or ***Oil***, it might be beneficial to halt the recruitment of ***Infantry*** units, through the disablement of the ***Recruitment Offices***, but only as a last resource.

#### ***Workshop***

<img title="{[Infrastructure]} - {[Workshop]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/upgrades_portrait/workshop_2_s1.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

##### ***Description of the Infrastructure:***

- Enables the production of ***Armoured Car*** units at ***Level 1*** and ***Balloon*** units at ***Level 2***.
- It is a necessary ***Building*** for the subsequent construction of ***Factories***.
- It might suit oneself to construct ***Workshops*** where one is predicting erecting ***Factories*** later on, meaning, ***Double Resources Provinces*** and ***Single Resources Provinces*** that possess rarer ***Resources*** like ***Oil***.
- Due to their low construction costs and short erecting time, ***Workshops*** can and should be build early on, even for the most frugal of ***Players***.

##### ***Notes & Observations:***

- Enables the production of ***Cavalry*** units at ***Level 1***, with the caveat of having a ***Workshop*** built in the same ***Province***.
- Every ***Province*** with ***Barracks*** built into, will have a bonus of ***Infantry*** recruitment, that increases alongside with that same ***Infrastructure's Level***.
- It is advised that the ***General*** construct this ***Infrastructures*** in ***Double Resource Provinces*** as to accentuate even more the bonus to recruitment of ***Infantry*** units (which is already enhanced in this type of ***Provinces***), and also the fact that these will be the main local for construction of both ***Workshops*** (needed as well to produce ***Cavalry*** units) and ***Factories*** (which increase even more the production speed of the later units).
- Can be deactivated, at any time, which immediately halts the production of ***Cavalry*** units, removes the bonus to the recruitment of ***Infantry*** units, but annuls the payment of the ***Upkeep*** at the same time.
- While being an ***Infrastructure*** with a very demanding ***Upkeep***, especially in the ***Early Game***, it might be very suited to ***Nations*** that have in their core territory an ample abundance of ***Food Resource Provinces***, and it is a must if those said ***Nations*** start with 2 ***Double Food Resource Provinces***.

##### ***Notes & Observations:***

- The main ***Infrastructure*** dedicated to the defence of ***Provinces*** and protection of their ***Garrisons***, is one of the most, if not the most crucial ***Infrastructure*** to be erected during all of the ***Scenario's*** duration, especially in the ***Early Game***, where it can mean the difference between survival or obliteration.

- From ***Level 3*** onward, this ***Infrastructure*** awards the ***Stealth*** property to any ***Army/Squadron*** that resides in the center of the ***Province*** where it has been built, making those same ***Military Units's*** composition invisible to any ***Neutral*** or ***Enemy*** ***Nation***, although this situation can be circumvented with a reduced number of ***Actions***. For more information on this subject, please read the [***In this Section***]().

- In addition to the defence and ***Stealth*** capabilities supplied by ***Fortresses***, these also give the ***General*** a slight ***Morale Development*** bonus that, although not the highest amongst the ***Infrastructures*** at early ***Levels***, comes cheaper than most, when it comes to both ***Building Cost*** and ***Building Time***.

##### ***Notes & Observations:***

- Enables the production of ***Light Cruiser*** units, ***Submarine*** units and ***Battleship*** units with the caveat of having a ***Factory*** at ***Level 1***, ***Level 2*** and ***Level 3*** respectively, built in the same ***Province*** where the ***Harbour*** was constructed.
- The only ***Infrastructure*** that changes the way ***Terrestrial*** and ***Aerial Units*** interact with bodies of water (***Lakes***, ***Seas*** and ***Oceans***), by providing a bonus of 50% decreased timing to the actions of ***Embarking*** (land to water) and ***Disembarking*** (water to land).
- Although it might seem a ***Infrastructure*** that gives a considerable amount of bonuses to the ***General***, its high ***Lumber*** ***Construction Cost*** and ***Construction Time*** places it quite a bit behind when compared to ***Railways*** and ***Factories***. Due to this fact, a ***General*** should be careful when choosing to build one, especially in the ***Early Game***, since both ***Harbours*** and ***Railways*** by having both a ***Construction Time*** of ***72 hours*** (***3 days***), only allow for one of this ***Infrastructures*** to be finished before ***Day 6***, at which point the ***Factories*** become available and this should be higher in the ***General's*** priority list.
- As it was mentioned before, the ***Harbour*** reduces ***Embarking*** and ***Disembarking*** times for the ***Military Units*** of the ***General*** that owns the ***Province*** where it was built, but any enemy or neutral ***Army***, when performing the same ***Actions*** also basks in the bonus. For this and others reasons, the placement of ***Harbours*** within each ***Province*** that has more than 2 suitable places for its construction is quite important. 
  A ***General*** should always try to have the same space between ***Harbours***, so that its ***Armies/Squadrons*** have a wider choice of ***Embarking***/***Disembarking***, without having to transverse a large area of territory. On the same note, the placement of this ***Infrastructure*** will also affect how quickly ***Naval Units*** will be able to join the front lines, and how protected will those same units be once their production concludes, which should be taken in consideration.

##### ***Notes & Observations:***

- Enables the production of ***Railroad Gun*** units, as long as the ***General*** has a ***Factory*** at ***Level 3*** , present in the ***Province*** that has an active ***Railway***.
- The singular ***Infrastructure*** that impacts the ***Movement Speed*** of both ***Terrestrial*** and ***Aerial Units*** (the later, by land, and to a smaller degree), with values ranging from increments of ***25%*** (***Armoured Car Units***) to ***200%*** (***Heavy Tank Units***). For a more detailed information, please inspect the [***Statistics on Movement of Military Units***](#statistics-on-movement-of-military-units) section.
- Probably the most efficient ***Infrastructure*** at a ***Generals*** disposal, when ***Construction Time***, ***Construction Cost*** and bonuses are taken into consideration,  placing it at an almost indispensable tier, during all the round's duration and especially in the ***Early Game*** (***1st Day*** to the ***12th Day***).
- As it is with ***Harbours*** when it comes to providing bonuses to both friend and foe, the same happens with ***Railroads***, where the later increases both neutral ***Armies's***, friendly ***Armies's*** and hostile ***Armies's*** ***Movement Speed***, although, in this case, the ***General*** that owns that same ***Infrastructure*** has the capability to deactivate it, which nullifies all the bonuses linked to the ***Railroad*** (***Morale Development*** bonus, ***Resources Production*** bonus and ***Special Bonus***) with the addition of also preventing the need to pay for the ***Upkeep***.

- Can only be erected in ***Provinces*** that possess ***Workshops*** at ***Level 2***.
- These ***Infrastructures*** are the industrial hearts of a ***General's*** ***Nation***, where more complex ***Military Units*** are produced, with increased ***Production Speed*** as the same is upgraded whilst also adding bonuses to ***Morale Development*** and ***Resource Production***.
- Although more upgrade levels are needed for this building to reach its maximum potential when compared with other ***Infrastructures***, ***Factories*** per level tend to be more affordable than most.
- Most ***Infrastructures*** demand a preemptively planing in order to not waste precious ***Resources*** in their construction, but nowhere is this more prevalent than when the ***General*** is dealing with the erection of ***Factories***, that by their sheer amount of upgrade levels in conjunction with their ***Build Cost***, makes it so that the same must be absolutely committed to its maximisation, therefore an even greater planning of where to build this buildings.

##### ***Notes & Observations:***

- The core of the ***Aerial Military Complex***, ***Aerodromes*** are essential to ***Generals*** that want to build an ***Air Force***.
- Enables the production of ***Fighters*** units and ***Bomber*** units, with the condition that the ***General*** has a ***Factory*** at ***Level 2*** and ***Level 3*** respectively, present in the same ***Province*** where the ***Aerodrome*** was erected.
- ***Aerodromes*** allow ***Generals*** to perform actions with their ***Aerial Units***, such as ***Bombardments*** and ***Patrols***, which can be seen in more detail [***In This Section***](). They are the ***Infrastructure*** responsible for refuelling both of the ***Aerial Units*** previously mentioned, in between any ***Action*** taken by those.

#### ***Capital Building***

<img title="{[Infrastructure]} - {[Capital Building]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/upgrades_portrait/capitol_s1.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

##### ***Description of the Infrastructure:***

> ***The center of a country's power, the Capital is necessary to maintain morale in all provinces. The farther a province is to a capital, the higher the penalty to its Morale. Keep them safe, as losing a capital results in Morale and Resource penalties.***

##### ***Notes & Observations:***

- The most important ***Infrastructure*** in the ***General's*** possession, and at the loss of same, the ***General*** incurs in an acute decrease of ***Province Morale*** by ***20 Points*** with a constant penalty of ***40 Points*** until the construction of a new one, while losing ***50%*** of his own ***Sterlings*** to the aggressor as well.

- In the same note, but on the opposite side of the coin, the destruction of an enemy ***Capital Building*** will afford the victor ***10 Points*** of ***Morale*** in all of his ***Provinces*** (with the exception of the enemy ***Capital Province*** just acquired), allied with the gain a whole day's worth of ***Resources*** (based on ***Resource Production*** of the defeated) and ***50%*** of the defeated's ***Sterlings***.

### ***Description, Attributes and Properties of Military Units***

#### ***Terrestrial Military Complex Units***

##### ***Infantry***

<img title="{[Military Unit]} - [Unmechanized] - [Melee] - {[Infantry]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/infantry_s3.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***These foot soldiers, trained to carry their equipment and fight, are the backbone of all armies. Although weaker than other units, they are constantly replenished by recruiting campaigns and can be used to bulk up armies or to protect territories.***

<br/>

---

##### ***Armoured Car***

<img src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/car_s3.jpg" title="{[Military Unit]} - [Mechanized] - [Melee] - {[Armoured Car]}" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***A lightweight wheeled armored vehicle, deployed for reconnaissance, escort and defensive purposes. Their speed allows for quick movement between provinces to subjugate light enemy troops***

<br/>

---

##### ***Cavalry***

<img title="{[Military Unit]} - [Unmechanized] - [Melee] - {[Cavalry]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/cavalry_s3.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***Considerably cheap unite that is mounted on fast horses for early war reconnaissance and skirmishing, making it very effective against infantry or for scouting ahead.***

<br/>

---

##### ***Storm Trooper***

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***The Stormtroopers are a powerful offensive unit that deals devastating damage to the enemy. When covered by Infantry, Stromtroopers can make quick work of enemy fortifications and live to tell the tale.***

<br/>

---

##### ***Artillery***

<img src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/artillery_s3.jpg" title="{[Military Unit]} - [Mechanized] - [Ranged] - {[Artillery]}" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***The Artillery is a heavy ranged weapon that can change the course of the war. It enables armies to bombard enemies from a distance. Very effective against slow targets and to breach defenses.***

<br/>

---

##### ***Tank***

<img title="{[Military Unit]} - [Mechanized] - [Melee] - {[Tank]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/tank_s3.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***Intended as a primary offensive weapon in front-line ground combat, tanks deal high damage and can move at a decent speed. Costs are considerably higher compared to other units, but survivability is too!***

<br/>

---

##### ***Heavy Tank***

<img title="{[Military Unit]} - [Mechanized] - [Melee] - {[Heavy Tank]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/mkiv_tank_s3.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***Proving to be an effective war tool, tanks had their firepower and defensive capabilities greatly improved by technology. These units can defend key positions and lead considerably strong ground offensive attacks.***

<br/>

---

##### ***Railroad Gun***

<img title="{[Military Unit]} - [Mechanized] - [Ranged] - {[Railroad Gun]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/railgun_s3.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***This machine can only navigate on railroads because it is composed by a large-caliber cannon that is mounted on top of a heavy wagon. Despite its low mobility this unit can inflict devastating damage to enemies from a large distance.***

<br/>

---

---

#### ***Naval Military Complex Units***

##### ***Light Cruiser***

<img title="{[Military Unit]} - [Mechanized] - [Ranged] - {[Light Cruiser]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/cruiser_s3.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***This medium-sized light armored warship is cheap and effective against airplanes. It can also target ground units near the shoreline with its sort ranged attack, but it is quite vulnerable to other naval units.***

<br/>

---

##### ***Submarine***

<img src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/submarine_s3.jpg" title="{[Military Unit]} - [Mechanized] - [Melee] - {[Submarine]}" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***Submersive battle vessels that are very effective at attacking ships and scouting the seas. They have the capacity of operating in stealth for days or even months, unless revealed by scouting parties or by starting combat.***

<br/>

---

##### ***Battleship***

<img title="{[Military Unit]} - [Mechanized] - [Ranged] - {[Battleship]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/battleship_s3.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***The capability of effectively bombarding land targets from the safety of the sea makes Battleships a force to be reckoned with. Despite having tremendous power they are also slow and costly and can be vulnerable to Submarines or Bomber attacks.***

<br/>

---

---

#### ***Aerial Military Complex Units***

##### ***Balloon***

<img title="{[Military Unit]} - [Mechanized] - [Melee] - {[Balloon]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/balloon_s3.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***Balloons are cheap units that can scout enemy territories with their unrivalled view range. This is specially useful in a war with large-scale use of ground units and aircrafts. As they are tethered to the ground, they can only be moved on connections.***

##### <br/>

---

##### ***Fighter***

<img title="{[Military Unit]} - [Mechanized] - [Ranged] - {[Fighter]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/airplane_s3.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***Fighters are designed primarily for air-to-air combat focusing on maneuverability. A group of fighters can guarantee complete domination over the airspace to allow other air units, like Bombers, to fulfil their missions without risk.***

<br/>

---

##### ***Bomber***

<img title="{[Military Unit]} - [Mechanized] - [Ranged] - {[Bomber]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/bomber_s3.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***These planes are responsible for demoralizing enemies by disrupting their economy and military operations with destructive bombing attacks. They can be used to pick-off ground targets or to destroy buildings.***

<br/>

---

##### ***Zeppelin***

<img title="{[Military Unit]} - [Mechanized] - [Ranged] - {[Zeppelin]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/clients/s1914-client-ultimate/s1914-client-ultimate_live/images/units_portrait/zeppelin_s3.jpg" alt="" data-align="center">

###### ***Description of the Military Unit:***

> ***The Zeppelin is a large airship carrying a significant bombload which it can deliver to all but the most distant targets. Due to its slow speed it is best used on long patrol missions above enemy cities, on which it will grind down both the local infrastructure and morale.***

<br/>

### ***Description, Attributes and Properties of Heroes***

#### ***1º Viscount Edmund H. Allenby of Flextowe and Meggido - "The Lancer of Britannia"***

<br/>

<img title="{[Hero]} - [Cavalry Hero] - {[1º Viscount Edmund H. Allenby]}" src="https://clan.fastly.steamstatic.com/images//34123292/ba892b7ce531979d6b46bebfd8afef98e75a7901.png" alt="" width="548" data-align="center">

##### ***Description of the Hero:***

> ***Viscount Allenby is a distinguished general whose presence boosts the speediness of his forces. His leadership grants a buff to all cavalry units' attack damage in his army, making him a key asset for cavalry-centric strategies.
> Edmund Allenby was a British field marshal known for his leadership during World War I, particularly in the Middle East, where he successfully commanded the Egyptian Expeditionary Force.***

<br/>

---

---

#### ***Orhan "Kangal" Demir - "The Armoured Partisan"***

<br/>

<img title="{[Hero]} - [Armoured Car Hero] - {[Orhan ''Kangal'' Demir]}" src="https://clan.fastly.steamstatic.com/images//34123292/458d1c91c945c8f371961adce30983a1f8a90041.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="547">

##### ***Description of the Hero:***

> ***Orhan ''Kangal'' Demir excels at quick relocation and swift establishment of defensive positions.
> His personal retinue consists of several Armoured Cars which perfectly fit his defensive tactics. All Armoured Cars under his direct command gain increased defensive properties.
> A skilled tactician from Edirne, Orhan earned his nickname by capturing and mastering enemy vehicles, using them to outmaneuver foes and protect his homeland.***

<br/>

<img title="{[Skills]} - [Armoured Car Hero] - {[Orhan ''Kangal'' Demir]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/uploads/pics/1724407523_news_images_31472.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="547">

<br/>

---

---

#### ***Henry "Hank" Callahan - "The Relentless Corporal"***

<br/>

<img title="{[Hero]} - [Infantry Hero] - {[Henry ''Hank'' Callahan]}" src="https://clan.fastly.steamstatic.com/images//34123292/6f5a2b373f34c1294c56f656087209b0505417f6.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="546">

##### ***Description of the Hero:***

> ***Henry Callahan, known to his comrades simply as ''Hank'', was quickly recognized for his natural leadership abilities after enlisting. He is driven by his sense of duty and camaraderie with his men, determined to do his part to bring the war to a swift end. On the front lines, "Hank" quickly understood that battles are won by firepower as much as they are by the morale of the men fighting them. He fights alongside his men, sharing their hardships and dangers, proving a reliable leader even in the thickest chaos of battles.
> Having earned the respect of his men, all Infantry under his command is invigorated to their best, boosting their offensive and defensive capabilities.***

<br/>

<img title="{[Skills]} - [Infantry Hero] - {[Henry ''Hank'' Callahan]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/uploads/pics/1724855175_news_images_31498.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="546">

<br/>

---

---

#### ***Georg "Breakthrough-Müller" Bruchmüller - "The Master of Artillery"***

<br/>

<img title="{[Hero]} - [Artillery Hero] - {[Georg ''Breakthrough-Müller'' Brunchmüller]}" src="https://clan.fastly.steamstatic.com/images//34123292/235f8f59ba8a6a68a9734b4e693e0bd6eedfc741.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="550">

##### ***Description of the Hero:***

> ***Georg Bruchmüller, nicknamed "Breakthrough-Müller" for the resounding success of his ideas, revolutionized artillery tactics during World War I. His innovative use of coordinated, rapid-fire bombardments broke the deadlock of trench warfare, allowing German forces to achieve decisive breakthroughs.
> Bruchmüller meticulous planning and innovative use of artillery increases the effective firepower of all Artillery units under his command, as well as allowing for their swift redeployment.***

<br/>

<img title="{[Skills]} - [Artillery Hero] - {[Georg ''Breakthrough-Müller'' Brunchmüller]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/uploads/pics/1725373643_news_images_31551.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="549">

<br/>

---

---

#### ***T.E. Lawrence "of Arabia" - "The Desert's Legend"***

<br/>

<img title="{[Hero]} - [Cavalry Hero] - {[T.E. Lawrence ''of Arabia'']}" src="https://clan.fastly.steamstatic.com/images//34123292/b23392184e5798555a0708427427c2154f9788fa.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="547">

##### ***Description of the Hero:***

> ***A legend in the making, T. E. Lawrence played a pivotal role in the collapse of the Ottoman Empire. Later recognized as the famous ''Lawrence of Arabia'', he rallied militias across the desert, drawing his rebel bands from all walks of life and striking where the oppressor was vulnerable.
> Fast-moving and independent, ''Lawrence of Arabia'' is a threat even separated from his men and more than a match for anything but the most reinforced of strongholds.***

<br/>

<img title="{[Skills]} - [Cavalry Hero] - {[T.E. Lawrence ''of Arabia'']}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/uploads/pics/1725374066_news_images_31552.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="546">

<br/>

---

---

#### ***Fiero "Marco" Martello - "The Master Engineer"***

<br/>

<img title="{[Hero]} - [Tank & Heavy Tank Hero] - {[Fiero “Marco” Martello]}" src="https://clan.fastly.steamstatic.com/images//34123292/81b3c281c4e4299e1d79dba0ebd8900e9bed7880.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="544">

##### ***Description of the Hero:***

> ***Fiero Martello was known for being kind-hearted and gifted mechanic in this hometown of Naples before the outbreak of the war. He refused to serve in a direct combat role, but quickly proved his worth as a pragmatic engineer in service of his country. ''Marco'', as he is jokingly called, is well respected by his comrades for his thorough work ethic and skill. Much like ''Marco'' himself, a tank maintained by him is a tank you can rely on. Always.***

<br/>

<img title="{[Skills]} - [Tank & Heavy Tank Hero] - {[Fiero “Marco” Martello]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/uploads/pics/1730456631_news_images_32316.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="543">

<br/>

---

---

#### ***Joseph Joffre - "The Defender of France"***

<br/>

<img title="{[Hero]} - [Armoured Car Hero] - {[Joseph Joffre]}" src="https://clan.fastly.steamstatic.com/images//34123292/36040b8aba3492a7e29cf00ef08a0d6b17750376.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="542">

##### ***Description of the Hero:***

> ***Joseph Joffre served as Commander-in-Chief of the French army and is best known as the ''Victor of the Marne'' for his pivotal role in halting the German advance in 1914. 
> Renowned for his defensive prowess, Joffre specializes in fortifying friendly territory with Infantry and Armoured Cars. His ability to boost Infantry movement speed ensures a swift and organized defense, making him a master of resilient, rapid-response strategies.***

<br/>

<img title="{[Skills]} - [Armoured Car Hero] - {[Joseph Joffre]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/uploads/pics/1730456579_news_images_32315.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="542">

<br/>

---

---

#### ***Tatiana Minchakievich - "The Angel of Death"***

<br/>

<img title="{[Hero]} - [Infantry Hero] - {[Tatiana Minchakievich]}" src="https://clan.fastly.steamstatic.com/images//34123292/371c6e4af0989a262d8747ae0baf11c2c5fc2f75.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="541">

##### ***Description of the Hero:***

> ***Not much is known about Tatiana's past before the war. Together with her sister Olga, she volunteered to serve in the all-women ''Battalion of Death'', being one of the few to endure under their commander's strict discipline. She proved to be an excellent shot, quickly establishing a reputation as a skilled Sniper. Preferring to avoid open battle, Tatiana instead takes advantage of the terrain to move swiftly, always on the prowl for her next kill.
> She excels when operating on enemy territory, using her excellent tracking and stalking skills to scout out positions, gather intel and instil terror in the hearts of her enemies.***

<br/>

<img title="{[Skills]} - [Infantry Hero] - {[Tatiana Minchakievich]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/uploads/pics/1730993494_news_images_32372.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="540">

<br/>

---

---

#### ***Togo Heihachiro - "The Hero of Tsushima"***

<br/>

<img title="{[Hero]} - [Battleship Hero] - {[Togo Heihachiro]}" src="https://clan.fastly.steamstatic.com/images//34123292/828a24c221f1b82665c9a9d6ca43c83020fdf1f7.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="539">

##### ***Description of the Hero:***

> ***Togo Heihachiro was a legendary Japanese naval commander who played a key role in modernizing Japan's navy. His innovative tactics and disciplined leadership secured victory in the Russo-Japanese war, solidifying Japan's dominance in East Asia.
> Battleships under his command perform at their absolute best, dealing more damage to the enemy while sustaining more hits themselves. Additionally, Togo can order a devastating barrage, bombarding all units, including friendly ones within a large sea area or shorelines.***

<br/>

<img title="{[Skills]} - [Battleship Hero] - {[Togo Heihachiro]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/uploads/pics/1733480289_news_images_32783.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="537">

<br/>

---

---

#### ***John J. Pershing - "The Unyielding Commander"***

<br/>

<img title="{[Hero]} - [Infantry Hero] - {[John J. Pershing]}" src="https://clan.fastly.steamstatic.com/images//34123292/34fd79ec8bb060608b91faaac1103aa40af439a9.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="536">

##### ***Description of the Hero:***

> ***John J. Pershing, known as ''Black Jack'', was a pivotal figure in American military history. During the First World War, he transformed a small and unprepared U.S. army into a formidable, modern fighting force. Known for his discipline and high standards, Pershing demanded excellence from every man under his command. He returned home a victorious national hero, earning him the rank of General of the Armies and solidifying his place as one of America's greatest military leaders.
> His focus on rigorous training results in Infantry units under his command to retain unit cohesion even in the thickest of battles, while well coordinated attacks together with mobile and armoured units types inflicts heavy casualties on the enemy.***

<br/>

<img title="{[Skills]} - [Infantry Hero] - {[John J. Pershing]}" src="https://www.supremacy1914.com/uploads/pics/1734088989_news_images_32842.jpg" alt="" data-align="center" width="536">

<br/>

- ***Hitpoint Boosters*** are ***Boosters*** that increase the ***Hitpoints*** of a designated ***Military Unit***.
